intro: Paepalanthus saxicola, commonly known as the rock cactus, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly in Argentina and Chile. It is a member of the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its compact, spiny growth habit. The plant produces small, white or yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in arid and rocky environments, adapting to poor soil conditions. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in succulent gardens.
